main event: An unidentified flying object was observed over Nome and Unalakleet, Alaska, on February 15, 1960, described as traveling at very high speed and exhibiting characteristics similar to a meteor.
interesting points: The object was tracked by witnesses in multiple locations including Nome, St. Michael, and Unalakleet.,Witnesses reported seeing a bright, tubular object emitting flames from the tail.,The sighting was reported to have occurred over a 7-8 second duration.,Alaskan Air Command determined that the object was likely a meteor based on observations.,The sighting received significant media attention and was reported in local news outlets.
witness description: civilians including a station manager and a pilot
